briefdescription.para: Iterate over a list of clients.

memberdef.name: wl_resource_for_each_safe
memberdef.initializer: for (resource = 0, tmp = 0, \ resource = wl_resource_from_link((list)->next), \ tmp = wl_resource_from_link((list)->next->next); \ wl_resource_get_link(resource) != (list); \ resource = tmp, \ tmp = wl_resource_from_link(wl_resource_get_link(resource)->next))

memberdef.definition: typedef bool(* wl_display_global_filter_func_t) (const struct wl_client *client, const struct wl_global *global, void *data)
memberdef.argsstring: )(const struct wl_client *client, const struct wl_global *global, void *data)
memberdef.name: wl_display_global_filter_func_t

briefdescription.para: A filter function for wl_global objects.

detaileddescription.para:
client
The client object
global
The global object to show or hide
data
The user data pointer
A filter function enables the server to decide which globals to advertise to each client.
When a wl_global filter is set, the given callback funtion will be called during wl_global advertisment and binding.
This function should return true if the global object should be made visible to the client or false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Registers a listener for the client connection signal.

detaileddescription.para: When a new client object is created, listener will be notified, carrying a pointer to the new wl_client object.
